welcome.title: Welcome to Flowentra! ğŸ‘‹
welcome.content: Let us give you a comprehensive tour of all features. This will help you understand every button, action, and workflow in the platform. You can skip anytime and replay from your profile menu.

mobileMenu.title: Navigation Menu ğŸ“±
mobileMenu.content: Tap this menu icon to access all modules: Workspace, CRM, Service, and System settings. Each section contains tools to manage your business efficiently.

sidebar.title: Navigation Sidebar ğŸ“Œ
sidebar.content: Your main navigation hub! All modules are organized into sections: Workspace (contacts, articles), CRM (offers, sales, todo), Service (dispatches, service orders), and System (settings, users). Click any item to explore.

header.title: Dashboard Header âš¡
header.content: Your control center for quick actions. Access search, create new items, view notifications, get help, and manage your account. The header stays visible as you navigate.

globalSearch.title: Global Search ğŸ”
globalSearch.content: Find anything instantly! Search across contacts, offers, sales, service orders, articles, and more. Press Ctrl+K (Cmd+K on Mac) to open search from anywhere. Results appear in real-time as you type.

quickCreate.title: Quick Create Button â•
quickCreate.content: Create new items with one click! This button opens a menu to quickly add: Contacts, Offers, Sales, Service Orders, Articles, and more. No need to navigate away from your current view.

notifications.title: Notifications Bell ğŸ””
notifications.content: Stay informed! Receive alerts for: new tasks assigned, status changes on your items, messages from team members, and important system updates. Click to view details or mark all as read.

askAi.title: AI Assistant ğŸ¤–
askAi.content: Get instant help! Ask questions about Flowentra in natural language. The AI understands the entire platform and can guide you through: creating offers, managing service orders, using the dispatcher, understanding status workflows, and more. Available in English and French!

userMenu.title: Your Account Menu ğŸ‘¤
userMenu.content: Access your profile settings, change theme (light/dark mode), view preferences, replay this tour, and sign out. Your initials appear here for quick identification.

kpiCards.title: KPI Dashboard Cards ğŸ“Š
kpiCards.content: Real-time business metrics! See monthly revenue, total contacts, active offers, completed sales, and inventory alerts. Click any card to navigate directly to that module for details.

salesChart.title: Sales Status Chart ğŸ“ˆ
salesChart.content: Visual breakdown of sales by status: In Progress (active), Closed (completed), and Cancelled. Click 'View All' to see the full sales list and manage individual sales.

offersChart.title: Offers Pipeline Chart ğŸ¯
offersChart.content: Track offers through stages: Draft â†’ Sent â†’ Negotiation â†’ Accepted/Rejected. This helps identify bottlenecks and optimize your conversion rate. Click 'View All' for the full list.

crmSection.title: CRM Module ğŸ’¼
crmSection.content: Your customer relationship tools! Includes: Offers (quotes to clients), Sales (confirmed orders), Todo (task management), and Time & Expenses (tracking billable work). Click to expand and explore each.

serviceSection.title: Service Module ğŸ”§
serviceSection.content: Field service management! Includes: Service Orders (work to be done), Dispatches (scheduled jobs), Dispatcher (planning interface), and Installations (equipment tracking). Perfect for field teams.

systemSection.title: System Settings âš™ï¸
systemSection.content: Admin configuration area! Manage: Users & Roles (access control), Lookups (dropdown values), Workflows (automation), Dynamic Forms (custom checklists), and System Settings (company preferences). Restricted to administrators.

dynamicFormsModule.title: Dynamic Forms Module ğŸ“‹
dynamicFormsModule.content: Create custom forms, checklists, and surveys without coding! Build bilingual forms (English/French) with 15+ field types including text, dropdowns, signatures, ratings, and more. Perfect for inspections, customer feedback, and compliance checklists.

dynamicFormsBuilder.title: Form Builder Interface ğŸ› ï¸
dynamicFormsBuilder.content: The builder has 3 columns: Field Palette (drag field types), Form Canvas (arrange your form), and Field Properties (configure each field). Drag fields from the palette to the canvas, then configure labels, validation, and conditional logic in the properties panel.

dynamicFormsFeatures.title: Advanced Form Features âœ¨
dynamicFormsFeatures.content: Power features include: Multi-page forms (page breaks for long checklists), Conditional Logic (show/hide fields based on answers), Digital Signatures (capture on-screen), Star Ratings, and PDF Export. Forms follow a lifecycle: Draft â†’ Released â†’ Archived.

helpButton.title: Help & Support â“
helpButton.content: Get assistance anytime! Access: FAQ (common questions), AI Assistant (instant answers), Support Tickets (contact team), and Documentation. You can also restart this tour from here.

offersModule.title: Offers Module Overview ğŸ“
offersModule.content: Create and manage quotes for your clients. An offer contains: customer info, line items (articles/services), pricing, discounts, and validity dates. Offers can be converted to sales when accepted.

offersAddButton.title: Add New Offer â•
offersAddButton.content: Click this button to create a new offer. You'll enter: customer details, select articles/services, set quantities and prices, apply discounts, and set validity period. Save as draft or send directly.

offersStatusChange.title: Offer Status Workflow ğŸ”„
offersStatusChange.content: Offers follow this workflow: Draft (editing) â†’ Sent (to customer) â†’ Negotiation (discussions) â†’ Accepted âœ“ or Rejected âœ—. Use the status dropdown to update. Accepted offers can be converted to Sales.

offersConvertToSale.title: Convert Offer to Sale âœ…
offersConvertToSale.content: When a customer accepts an offer, click 'Convert to Sale' to create a Sales Order. This copies all details automatically. If services are included, a Service Order is also generated with jobs to schedule.

offersDelete.title: Delete Offer ğŸ—‘ï¸
offersDelete.content: Remove unwanted offers using the delete button. Only draft offers can be deleted. Sent or accepted offers are archived for record-keeping. A confirmation dialog prevents accidental deletion.

offersEdit.title: Edit Offer âœï¸
offersEdit.content: Modify offer details: add/remove line items, adjust prices, change discounts, update customer info, or modify terms. Only draft offers can be fully edited. Sent offers require creating a revision.

salesModule.title: Sales Module Overview ğŸ’°
salesModule.content: Manage confirmed orders from accepted offers. Track payment status, generate invoices, monitor delivery, and view complete order history. Each sale links back to its original offer.

salesStatusChange.title: Sales Status Workflow ğŸ”„
salesStatusChange.content: Sales progress through: Created â†’ In Progress â†’ Partially Invoiced â†’ Fully Invoiced â†’ Closed. Use status dropdown to update. Cancelled sales are kept for reporting but excluded from active lists.

salesInvoice.title: Generate Invoice ğŸ§¾
salesInvoice.content: Create invoices from sales orders. You can invoice fully or partially (split billing). The system tracks: invoice number, amount, date, and payment status. Export as PDF for customers.

salesViewDetails.title: View Sale Details ğŸ‘ï¸
salesViewDetails.content: Click any sale to see complete information: customer details, line items, pricing, linked service orders, invoices generated, payment history, and activity timeline. All in one place.

serviceOrdersModule.title: Service Orders Overview ğŸ”§
serviceOrdersModule.content: Track work that needs to be performed. Service orders are created when sales include services. They contain jobs that are scheduled and assigned to technicians via dispatches.

serviceOrdersAddJob.title: Add Job to Service Order â•
serviceOrdersAddJob.content: Create jobs within a service order. Each job represents work at a specific location. Enter: description, estimated duration, required skills, and link to installation/equipment if applicable.

serviceOrdersStatusChange.title: Service Order Status ğŸ”„
serviceOrdersStatusChange.content: Service orders progress: Open (new) â†’ In Progress (jobs scheduled) â†’ Completed (all jobs done) â†’ Closed (finalized). Status updates automatically based on job completion. Manual override available.

dispatchModule.title: Dispatches Overview ğŸ“…
dispatchModule.content: Schedule and track field work. A dispatch is created when a job is assigned to a technician with a specific date/time. Technicians see their dispatches in Daily Tasks and update progress in real-time.

dispatchSchedule.title: Schedule Dispatch ğŸ“†
dispatchSchedule.content: Assign jobs to technicians: select the job, choose a technician, set date/time, and confirm. Use the Dispatcher interface for drag-and-drop scheduling. Consider technician availability and skills.

dispatchStatusChange.title: Dispatch Status Updates ğŸ”„
dispatchStatusChange.content: Dispatches progress: Scheduled â†’ En Route â†’ On Site â†’ In Progress â†’ Completed. Technicians update status from mobile. Managers see real-time progress on the dispatcher board.

dispatchTimeLogging.title: Log Time & Expenses â±ï¸
dispatchTimeLogging.content: Track billable work on dispatches. Log: start/end times, travel time, break deductions, and materials used. Add expenses with receipts. All entries link to the service order for invoicing.

dispatchNotes.title: Add Notes & Attachments ğŸ“
dispatchNotes.content: Document work performed: add notes, upload photos (before/after), attach documents, and record customer signatures. All information is saved to the dispatch and service order history.

contactsModule.title: Contacts Management ğŸ‘¥
contactsModule.content: Your customer database! Store: companies and individuals, contact details, addresses, communication history, linked offers/sales, and notes. Filter by type (Person/Company) or favorites.

contactsAddButton.title: Add New Contact â•
contactsAddButton.content: Create contacts for customers, suppliers, or partners. Enter: name, type (person/company), email, phone, address, and custom fields. Link contacts to parent companies for organization hierarchy.

contactsEdit.title: Edit Contact Details âœï¸
contactsEdit.content: Update contact information anytime. Changes are logged in activity history. Merge duplicate contacts, update addresses, add new phone numbers, or modify custom fields as needed.

contactsDelete.title: Delete Contact ğŸ—‘ï¸
contactsDelete.content: Remove contacts no longer needed. Contacts with linked offers, sales, or service orders cannot be deleted (archive instead). A confirmation dialog shows linked items before deletion.

articlesModule.title: Articles & Inventory ğŸ“¦
articlesModule.content: Manage your products and services catalog. Articles are added to offers and sales. Track: stock levels, pricing, categories, and suppliers. Set reorder alerts for low stock items.

articlesAddButton.title: Add New Article â•
articlesAddButton.content: Create articles for materials or services. Enter: name, code, description, type (Material/Service), unit price, cost price, and category. Materials can have stock tracking enabled.

articlesEdit.title: Edit Article Details âœï¸
articlesEdit.content: Modify article information: update prices, change descriptions, adjust stock levels, or update supplier info. Price changes don't affect existing offers/sales (historical pricing preserved).

articlesStockAdjust.title: Adjust Stock Levels ğŸ“Š
articlesStockAdjust.content: Correct inventory counts: add received stock, remove damaged items, or perform cycle counts. Each adjustment requires a reason and is logged for audit purposes. Set alerts for low stock.

complete.title: Tour Complete! ğŸ‰
complete.content: You now know all the key features! Remember: use Quick Create (â•) for fast actions, Global Search (ğŸ”) to find anything, and Help (â“) when stuck. Replay this tour anytime from your profile menu. Happy working!
